Class AssistantJack

    • Constructor Detail

      • AssistantJack

        public AssistantJack(int answerSet)
        The full constructor, specifying which assistant to use (answer set 1, answer set 2, or random). Depending on assistant, a different correct Theory object is created.
        Parameters:
        answerSet - 1 is a fixed answer of 1,1,1 and 2 is a fixed answer of 6,10,6 any other integer will be randomly assigned

      • AssistantJack

        public AssistantJack(Theory theory)
        Creates an assistant Jack with a theory that was passed in.
        Parameters:
        theory - deep copied object stored as correct theory

    • Method Detail

      • checkAnswer

        public int checkAnswer(int weapon,
                       int location,
                       int person)
        Will report to the user whether their theory is correct. It will return a number that needs to be interpreted (see return). Also keeps track of times asked by incrementing every time this method is called
        Parameters:
        weapon - the weapon used 1 - 6
        location - the location where it was done 1 - 10
        person - the person who did it 1 - 6
        Returns:
        0 if all three are correct, 1 if the weapon is incorrect, 2 if the location is incorrect and 3 if the person is incorrect. If multiple are incorrect it will randomly select one of the incorrect parts and return that.

      • checkAnswer

        public int checkAnswer(Theory theory)
        Pass through (convenient) method that converts the theory to numbers and sends it to the overloaded method.
        Parameters:
        theory - a theory of the murder, weapon and location
        Returns:
        0 if all three are correct, 1 if the weapon is incorrect, 2 if the location is incorrect and 3 if the person is incorrect. If multiple are incorrect it will randomly select one of the incorrect parts and return that.

      • getTimesAsked

        public int getTimesAsked()
        Accessor for times your AssistantJack has been asked to check a theory
        Returns:
        number of times AssistantJack has checkAnswer() been called
